column2:
The  NEXT  @AnthonyNolan COLLECTION is   
    Saturday 8th. December @waitrose #FORMBY
 Could You Come + Help 4A Few Hours +Help Save Lives  DM 4More INFO  @damienmooremp pic.twitter.com/Q0v4NMRROI

Absolutely right Damien. Recently in a full Council meeting they were questioned about the failure of the Southport Market. The Cabinet Member was drowning. They just haven’t got a clue about business or the role of infrastructure.
.@damienmooremp Thank you for your contribution to the shale gas #fracking debate: https://www.theyworkforyou.com/whall/?id=2018-10-31a.393.0&s=speaker%3A25630#g399.2 … @1010
Spot on. Labour Sefton council only use Southport residents for the council tax! They’re not interested in how we want it to be spent.https://twitter.com/MartynPBarber1/status/1058513174746578944 …

Interesting discussions and Q&A at the 6th All-Party Parliamentary Group on #Blockchain chaired by @damienmooremp at the @UKParliament
#APPG_blockchainpic.twitter.com/GHcWpEKqfj
Interesting, challenging and stimulating discussion about #blockchain. Me and fellow panellists. Thanks to @BigInnovCentre @damienmooremp @peterhunnpic.twitter.com/9M8MTbQKie

Southport MP @damienmooremp lays the foundation stone for Belong's eight village, in Birkdale, Merseyside. https://www.belong.org.uk/news/2018/11/mp-damien-moore-takes-up-a-new-seat-in-birkdale …pic.twitter.com/29EK9b2XFO
Thank you to everyone who helped me try and make Southport plastic free!pic.twitter.com/2brMjpxOw8

Jess, who's running a fantastic Stop Single Use campaign in Southport, points out that tiny things like cigarette butts and bottle tops can be just as damaging to our environment as the bigger plastics that build up on our beaches.pic.twitter.com/YcVncN1nDs

Amazing turnout for our beach clean today - including great volunteers from the Ocean Plaza @McDonalds. 

Southport Beach also looking incredible in the winter light!pic.twitter.com/gLRy95NhNl

Today the Defence Secretary is launching the first UK-wide Veterans Strategy, helping support those who served, as well as their families, in every aspect of their lives once they have hung up their uniform.pic.twitter.com/1NABlQD7U2

@damienmooremp our local MP is touring our hospital today. Here with some of the fantastic emergency department team. This is our recently opened clinical decision unit, which extends A&E capacity.pic.twitter.com/ELSYWCCavv
A&E matron Jane showing @damienmooremp around the renovation work, 60% of the unit will open on Monday pic.twitter.com/YjAC1BJkbX

In support of #WW 100-year anniversary, the rail industry is offering free rail travel to all active British military personnel travelling to Remembrance services on 11 November. Present a valid Military ID or wear your military uniform on the day and travel for free #ThankYou100
There's widespread dissatisfaction with @seftoncouncil in our town, but leader Ian Maher just makes cheap remarks. No wonder so many residents tell me things need to change.pic.twitter.com/efFJaAGepj

Southport sends many of our fantastic students to @LivUni. I loved touring the campus with Professor Fiona Beveridge - especially seeing the cutting edge Materials Innovation Factory and Central Teaching Laboratories.pic.twitter.com/SiP9BXbSBY
A stronger police presence is a key part of my plan for Southport. I recently met with @NickHurdUK, the policing minister, to discuss keeping our town safe and secure.pic.twitter.com/BfUiv8eOob
Congratulations!https://twitter.com/RuthDavidsonMSP/status/1055819124788678657 …
My next surgery will be on Friday 23rd November. If you have an issue that you'd like to discuss with me, please get in touch.pic.twitter.com/bMPr2jyBn5

As part of Colleges Week we invited MP @damienmooremp to visit the College and tour the new facilities. It was also an opportunity for the students to discuss their experience at KGV. Read more here --> https://www.kgv.ac.uk/news/2018-10-19-mp-damien-moore-visits-kgv-in-colleges-week … #MP #tourpic.twitter.com/4bmc5AKTkk
There is widespread dissatisfaction with @seftoncouncil, according to my survey. If you want to express your views, just click this link:https://buff.ly/2LiSr7Y

This afternoon I asked a Health & Social Care question to the Minister of State, Stephen Barclay MP, about the recycling of equipment at Southport Hospital. 

You can watch my question and the Minister's response below.pic.twitter.com/PA6eO2iBbm

Two thousand British people need a stem cell transplant every year to survive. I met with @kevdunne2 to talk about the work he's doing with #stemcellscours.

@AnthonyNolan is looking for both donors and volunteers. Please contact them.pic.twitter.com/iArwRP8qKh

Today, I am supporting Claire House Children's Hospice in their urgent appeal to reach every dying child.

You can help Claire House reach #EveryDyingChild by texting EVERY CHILD to 70500 to donate £5.pic.twitter.com/dmqKiOsuJC

By 2020, the number of plastics in our ocean will be ten times more than it is now - unless we do something about it. 

On Friday 23rd November, I'll be picking up destructive plastics with some great local volunteers. Please join us.pic.twitter.com/AyVsl7IgPp
Fantastic Q&A from @damienmooremp, some amazing answers on Brexit, freedom of speech, and technology pic.twitter.com/QpMydAXgHa

Fantastic  Meeting  With  and HONOURED 2Have
@damienmooremp Supporting #StemCellScousers @AnthonyNolan #MerseysideDefeatingBloodCancerpic.twitter.com/91AiI02dDY
Talking with some great students at @kgvcollege about everything they want to do in the future.pic.twitter.com/WQrrIXJHEo – At King George V College
The @BCE2018 have suggested changes to our constituency, and I want to know what you think about them. Click the link and take my surveyhttps://buff.ly/2HGS0P6

Our town's hospitality sector regularly caters to tens of thousands of tourists. Enda Ryland, the chief operating officer of The Waterfront Southport, joined me in Parliament to celebrate everyone who works in our bars, cafés, hotels, and restaurants.pic.twitter.com/GTJJsvfNL0
Thanks to @MattHancock and our Conservative government, @seftoncouncil will receive over a million and a half pounds to help prepare the NHS for winter.pic.twitter.com/PsmlhAa1TN

Wesley Street received a Special Mention from @TheGBHighSt Awards last week, but other places in our town are really struggling against big online retailers. So I welcomed @PhilipHammondUK's idea of a Digital Services Tax.pic.twitter.com/wyh27Z2l7I
I've joined fellow MPs in adding my name to a letter to @theresa_may, expressing our grave concern over the hounding of our military veterans.
Thanks @damienmooremp - we really enjoyed it! It was a really good event!
Thank you to everyone who came to my seniors fair last Friday, as well as those who made it possible - especially @FletchersLegalpic.twitter.com/H95is3Nhb7

I'm really proud of the work that so many people in our town do to fight antisemitism. 

Speaking to @JewishChron I talk about why I'm a committed defender of the State of Israel, as well as our Jewish friends and neighbours in Southport.https://buff.ly/2RIztHp
Around two hundred people attended my first Seniors Fair Friday. Thank you to everyone involved, including @FletchersLegal, @U3A_UK, @AgeUKLancashire, @alzheimerssocpic.twitter.com/vwomB1vDrn
Lots of information being given out already at the @damienmooremp community event in #Southport Great to be able to support people with services and share #winterwarmth tipspic.twitter.com/VtOSyX4yNb
Two of our fantastic local councillors, Harry Bliss and Sir Ron Watson, joining me at my Seniors Fair this afternoon.pic.twitter.com/SigY6bkB7o

Southport MP @damienmooremp tells the @JewishChron about his support for the Jewish community both locally and nationally following his engagement with the JLC. He also reflects on his visits to @JamiPeople and @Jewish_Carehttps://www.thejc.com/news/uk-news/he-may-have-only-500-jews-but-he-s-one-of-israel-s-biggest-defenders-1.470777 …
There are nearly 5000 people living with dementia in our area. At my Seniors Fair tomorrow, the @alzheimerssoc will be there to provide advice and support. Please come along.https://buff.ly/2zJa4qa
I’m pleased to hear that @pladis_Global is supporting and empowering its 4,500 UK employees by increasing training and awareness around mental health #WorldMentalHealthDay

.@U3A_UK provides excellent education courses for older people. They'll be at my Seniors Fair this Friday. It starts from 10am at Dunes Splash World. Hope to see you there! https://buff.ly/2zJa4qa pic.twitter.com/U1peXGckTE

Our town has the only flat green bowling club in our area. If you fancy joining, they'll be at my Seniors Fair this Friday. 

The fair starts from 10am at Dunes Splash World. Looking forward to seeing you there! https://buff.ly/2zJa4qa pic.twitter.com/OSb8Ck328V

My Seniors Fair is this Friday. Among many attractions, you'll get to meet the wonderful people at @SeftonOPERA.  

The fair will start from 10am at Dunes Splash World. Please join us!https://buff.ly/2zJa4qa
I'm very happy to support @nigelmp's call for a cut in beer duty and scrapping the annual RPI inflationary increases.pic.twitter.com/E862cPGp7v

Lipreading can reduce the isolation that those with hearing difficulties can sometimes feel. I really enjoyed taking a class at the Southport Fire Station. 

If you'd like to take part, classes are held every Friday between either 10.15am and 12.15pm or 1.15pm and 3.15pm.pic.twitter.com/ql3pcREhGA

Teachers could ask MPs questions, take part in workshops about how our democracy works, and explore new teaching ideas as part of Parliament's Teacher Ambassador Programme. Click the link and find out how to apply!https://buff.ly/2RpXMdm
Out of nearly 300 entries, Wesley Street received a Special Mention from @TheGBHighSt Awards. Let's see if we can get even further next year! @SouthportBID @JakeBerrypic.twitter.com/fG1lu0dXoZ
Your good cause could receive between £1000 and £25,000 from the @AvivaUK Community Fund. Applications close next next Tuesday. Click the link and check out the details! https://buff.ly/2NZ2hMR
Pretty sure people in Southport would agree! We pay tens of thousands more in Council Tax than any other area in Sefton...pic.twitter.com/zHYXDKv87j
The independent @BCE2018 has recommended changes to our constituency. I want to know your views on a new, bigger Southporthttps://buff.ly/2HGS0P6

Lipreading can reduce the isolation that those with hearing difficulties can sometimes feel. I really enjoyed taking a class at the Southport Fire Station. 

If you would like to take part, they're held every Friday: 10.15am to 12.15pm and 1.15pm to 3.15pm.pic.twitter.com/OAeBG4q0gI
@damienmooremp is encouraging others to get their eyes tested this National Eye Health Week. Here he is at Southport opticians Batty and Dexter ...   #EyeWeekpic.twitter.com/9SC2OKAZqe
If you're a constituent and need my help, please get in touch and we can talk at one of my regular surgeries.pic.twitter.com/WBcO7uaQ0h
I really enjoyed meeting @Barclays' great Southport team. We discussed everything they're doing for people and businesses in our town.pic.twitter.com/2MZenJnUnS

Thank you to @damienmooremp who is supporting National Eye Health Week by getting his eyes tested. Over 50% of sight loss is avoidable. #EyeWeek #VisionMattershttps://twitter.com/damienmooremp/status/1044172742621360129 …
Prevention is better than cure! Try to get your eyes tested, whether they seem fine or not.pic.twitter.com/KT3giRyIl2

It's National Eye Health Week! Please visit your nearest opticians and check your eyesight. 

Big thank you to @Gallowaysblind and Karl Spinks, from @BattyandDexter, for helping me take my test today.pic.twitter.com/0sU91NkGN0

I want us to have a good relationship with our European allies after Brexit, but it's only possible if the EU respects Britain and respects the referendum. @theresa_may is right to be robust in defending our country.
Rail replacement buses are now running between St George's Hall - Hunts Cross and vice versa.

Due to trees obstructing the line:

Services on the Hunts Cross line continue to start and terminate at Liverpool Central.

Services on the Southport line are starting/terminating at Hillside 

Replacement buses have been requested but are not yet in operation.
I'm really inspired by our town's veterans, as well as the volunteers who provide them with such vital advice and support.pic.twitter.com/C6NmtNkEv7

Over twelve million tonnes of plastic end up in the oceans. Given the importance of our seafront to our town, I believe we need to do our part to fight this. So please join me to pick up destructive plastic!pic.twitter.com/mvDqqOb4lW
I had a great time at @SONHStrust's recent open day. The teddy bear clinic was especially popular!pic.twitter.com/UtVMu6w0sU
Southport would be part of Lancashire again if @BCE2018's changes were approved. How do you feel about this? Click the link and tell mehttps://buff.ly/2HGS0P6
Do you have a problem you want to talk to me about? Please call or email me to arrange a surgery appointment.pic.twitter.com/r9z9HAnsAo
The retail industry pays far more in Business Rates than any other industry. So I was very happy to support @biraofficial's new manifesto about reviewing the rates.pic.twitter.com/lACOQ8rEZw
.@SONHStrust hospital will be given £280,000 to prepare for the challenges that come with winter. I met with the Health Secretary, @MattHancock, to discuss our great NHS.pic.twitter.com/AG0rc6qiDp
This week, @BCE2018 recommended the creation of a new, bigger Southport. I want to know how you feel about the changeshttps://buff.ly/2HGS0P6
Thank you so much for your show of support at our Sandpipers holiday centre @damienmooremp! Was wonderful to welcome you and we hope to see you again soon

In August, many brilliant volunteers joined me for a clean up of Ainsdale beach. We filled dozens of bags of destructive plastic. It was such a success that, on 23rd November, we'll be doing another beach clean! 

Please join us and make a difference to our town.pic.twitter.com/ta4swuO6PI

.@seftoncouncil don't invest enough in Southport. 

That's the view of the majority of people who've responded to our survey. If you want to take part, click the link.https://buff.ly/2LiSr7Y
Delighted attend the 52nd 24 Hour Yacht Race in Southport today with the Mayor, Cllr Dave Robinson. Good luck to the 77 clubs taking part!pic.twitter.com/2HA6J6CegQ
I was very happy to show my support to everyone who makes @RevitaliseNow and Sandpipers possible. They provide important respite to disabled people and their carers.pic.twitter.com/fC82CSioTQ
There's a widespread feeling that Southport isn't getting value for money from @seftoncouncil. Click the link and tell me what you thinkhttps://buff.ly/2LiSr7Y

On 17th November, I'll be leading another beach clean. Last month's clean up, on Ainsdale beach, attracted nearly forty volunteers - and resulted in the collection of over thirty bags of destructive plastic. 

If you would like to join our next big effort, please contact me.pic.twitter.com/sdQ4IYwe5K
Southport is enriched by our senior citizens. Next month, I'll be hosting a fair that'll provide them with advice, support - and new horizons. Click the link to find out more.https://buff.ly/2NdGDnY

Thank you @damienmooremp for your support this September during #BloodCancerAwarenessMonth. Did you know there are over 100 different types of blood cancer? Let's #MakeBloodCancerVisiblepic.twitter.com/hib8cv4qqZ
How do you feel about the challenges we face, both as a town and a country? Click the link and tell me!https://buff.ly/2HGS0P6

Cancer costs young patients and their families around £600 a month. 

September is Childhood Cancer Awareness Month, and I'm wearing a gold ribbon to raise awareness #CCAM @CLIC_Sargentpic.twitter.com/TF7zsnf88C

Light for Life provides an invaluable service for rough sleepers in Southport. Their staff will soon be wearing these t-shirts around the town. 

Our government has announced £100 million for a strategy to eradicate rough sleeping by 2027.pic.twitter.com/crl5sB6hfw
An organ donor can save or improve up to nine lives. I was very happy to show my support for the NHS Organ Donor Register.pic.twitter.com/0TslBX34v4

Great to attend Southport College’s University Centre graduation celebration. 

Fantastic to see so many Southport residents receive their higher education awards, including Jonathan here who has completed his degree in Computing & IT.pic.twitter.com/gLmYUqN4jY

Southport provides tens of millions more in Council Tax than any other part of Sefton - but many in our town feel they're not seeing value for money. Click the link and tell me what you think.https://buff.ly/2LiSr7Y

Britain should be the biggest foreign investor in Africa. I strongly support @theresa_may's ambition - and as chairman of the APPG for Tunisia, I hope to strengthen economic ties between their country and ours.
There's more to wheelchairs than most people think! @SONHStrust's excellent Wheelchair Service makes sure patients get one best suited to their needs @KathMJ2016pic.twitter.com/6C7ZCSHRTq
In October, I'm hosting a fair for senior citizens in our town. Please get in touch if you would like to be involved.pic.twitter.com/6yQh9ejntZ

After lobbying from myself, the government is removing vulnerable road users from its personal injury reforms - saving hundreds of jobs in important Southport businesses like @FletchersLegal 

I'm very grateful to @RoryStewartUK for listening to my concernspic.twitter.com/rPpznuT8qQ
I’m encouraging small shops in Southport to enter the UK Best Small Shops Competition. More details here: https://buff.ly/2vF8Adq  #indieretailpic.twitter.com/VOqTv2zPsH
.@QCHospice is an important place in our town - and those who run it are remarkable. Please click the link and show your support! https://buff.ly/2OWIqvy pic.twitter.com/e4YgpQ1jdN
I know this morning will be anxious for many students, but you should feel proud of the hard work you've put in over the last several months. Good luck!

Each year, one in three women aged 65+ fall each year. For men, it's one in five. The Falls Prevention Service in Southport does fantastic work helping those who have fallen or are at risk @LancashireCarepic.twitter.com/z9YqWE2Sy7

The Silcocks are synonymous with Southport. I was very happy to spend time with them at the iconic Funland and talk about their contribution to our town. Not least their ice cream parlour on Neville Street, where it's made on site with milk from Bates Dairy.pic.twitter.com/yjhx2Ru1jh
Don't forget! The deadline for the Great British High Street award is this Wednesday. I've already seen an amazing entry from Wesley Street.pic.twitter.com/GeQFW637Ge
I had a wonderful morning at @southport_fc last week. On Saturday 25th August, they're holding a 'Play on the Pitch' community event - and I urge you to go!pic.twitter.com/91dgLKAiZ0
I believe we all need to work together to make Southport a beautiful place to be. Lord Street in Bloom is a great example of the difference our community can make.pic.twitter.com/GGdb48UqSZ

Do I remind you of @GaryBarlow...or @rickastley...?

I had a very fun afternoon at Southport's @RotaryGBI!pic.twitter.com/mzK98mqr4N
I want to know what you think about the big issues facing our town - and our country. Click the link!https://buff.ly/2kBN4kt
Adam has been missing since Thursday - and his family and friends want to see him safe and home. If you think you can help, please get in touch.pic.twitter.com/BPELTJSRz7

.@Gallowaysblind is an amazing charity that helps the visually impaired fulfil their potential. I really enjoyed my time there, and listened to some great ideas about making Southport more accessible to the blind and partially sighted.pic.twitter.com/rW6xqPW4M6
It'll take just 30 seconds for you to tell me your feelings on the big issues facing us. Click the link!https://buff.ly/2HGS0P6

We deserve the best from rail operators. Our town relies on professionals commuting out and tourists travelling in. After we get past the disruption of the last few months, I hope to see a better experience for all passengers.https://buff.ly/2mUCgiU
I want to say a big thank you to everyone who helped me pick up plastic from Ainsdale beach yesterday - including the amazing volunteers from @McDonalds.pic.twitter.com/LuCYAYqA6a – At Ainsdale Beach
Do you believe Sefton Council invest enough in our town? Click the link and tell me how you feel.https://buff.ly/2LiSr7Y
Speaking to some of our amazing volunteers before we started cleaning Ainsdale beach today.pic.twitter.com/WD3SD7wY8t
Some of the incredible volunteers helping me pick up plastic on Ainsdale beach right now.pic.twitter.com/LH3KysipQT

Our town relies on tourists. They're attracted by our fairs, our gardens - and our beaches. 

This afternoon, I'll be picking up destructive plastic from Ainsdale beach. Please come and join me - and make a difference to our town.pic.twitter.com/iMI7yX2LXE

I'll be leading volunteers on Ainsdale beach tomorrow, picking up any destructive plastic. 

Please join me and make a difference to our town. We'll be kicking off at 12pm. Contact me for more details.pic.twitter.com/9rThIJmZGV

The Breathe Easy Sefton North group do incredible work for local residents affected by various types of lung disease. Through exercise and education, sufferers can be helped with their condition. 

You can visit their website here: https://buff.ly/2n8T1ac  @Mersey_Care @lungukpic.twitter.com/vRcTidLAEu

Over 5000 Southport residents live with osteoarthritis of the hip; over 8000 with osteoarthritis of the knee - and over 17,000 with back pain. 

I wanted to show my support for them and hear from arthritis sufferers about the help that makes a difference to their lives.pic.twitter.com/7zUfceaLcp

Have an opinion on house-building? Need to tell me your views on national security? I've created a survey for you! 

Please click the link and tell me what you think about the big issueshttps://buff.ly/2kBN4kt

Thousands of people choose our town for their retirement. In October, I'm hosting a fair for senior citizens, and I hope you will come along! 

Please contact me for details.pic.twitter.com/clVmk3efYC

Over 8 million people visited Southport in 2016. They were attracted to our fairs, our gardens - and our beaches. 

Next month, I'm leading volunteers picking up plastic on Ainsdale beach. The more of us there are, the bigger the impact. 

Come join us and make a difference.pic.twitter.com/B37DUQUnQ5

This was supposed to be a good year for rail passengers, with new and improved services. In trying to make our experiences better, however, things were made worse. 

Read my take on why the disruption happened, and the better future I hope we see.https://buff.ly/2mUCgiU

An important letter from @sajidjavid. 

Punishment for unlawful possession, supply, and production of cannabis remains unchanged. Yet it is important that our policies reflect what's best for patients.pic.twitter.com/n8Igi3adX7

Shockingly, Southport pays tens of millions more in Council Tax than any other area in Sefton. Yet most people in our town don't believe we see value for money. 

What can we do to change this? Click the link and tell me.https://buff.ly/2LiSr7Y

The government is heading in the right direction with the Civil Liability Bill, but it's wrong that vulnerable road users will face new obstacles to finding justice. They ought to be taken out of the legislation. https://buff.ly/2mCc4cC pic.twitter.com/YUi0rqYB1e

With the Conservatives giving millions to Merseyside, I hope @MetroMayorSteve will use the money to refurbish more stations in Southport - like our great new Ainsdale one! https://buff.ly/2Oe3Eos pic.twitter.com/UOkCLR3ZRJ
Thanks to the Conservatives, our region is receiving over a hundred million in funding for new infrastructure @RobertJenrickhttps://twitter.com/robertjenrick/status/1017422119024676865?s=21 …
Ainsdale has a great new station! I was very happy to be part of the opening @merseyrail @Merseytravelpic.twitter.com/xy6J8yLo0W

Pupils at @KewWoods have used a green screen to create their own news channel. I was very happy to show education minister @NickGibbUK what else the kids at this excellent school have been up to!pic.twitter.com/DvlbLuTaLB

I was glad to show off @greenbankhs to education minister @NickGibbUK. We talked to pupils and teachers, and had a great roundtable discussion about more mental health support for our children.pic.twitter.com/aBLxBalCdm
Thanks to @damienmooremp for attending our event and for pledging your support to the #YourHarvest campaign yesterday.pic.twitter.com/Ibb3tLyWtr
.@SmallBizSatUK and @idea_award are providing free, expert online training to small businesses. Click the link to register! https://buff.ly/2JbJCM8 pic.twitter.com/lePEja5N7a
Victoria Woodier is Southport's Young Musician of the Year. I was very happy to present her with the well-deserved award! @TrinityArts2pic.twitter.com/zWWhekmuxW

Can’t express how amazed I was by the progressive mind of @damienmooremp. This is how the future is being shaped! Damien, personal thanks for your inspiring pitch at the @appg_blockchainpic.twitter.com/FnhP2hDjNs

Our second Advisory Board Meeting is underway, right before our summer reception... hope to see you all soon! #appgblockchain @damienmooremp @BirgitteBIC @BigInnovCentre @grantshappspic.twitter.com/kVWhvgkYoT
My office is looking into it...https://twitter.com/samuel_p_currie/status/1018804197620412416 …

The University of the Third Age (@U3A_UK) creates exciting learning opportunities for the elderly - and breaks down the barrier of loneliness. I was very happy to show my support.pic.twitter.com/iXCMXX5lNM
Looking forward to it!https://twitter.com/trinityarts2/status/1017725062944878592 …

Strong music & drama and a good grounding in phonics, underpin high expectations at Kew Woods Primary School in Southport. Christina Jackson leads a team of teachers delivering very high academic standards. Invited to the school by local MP Damien Moore. @KewWoods @damienmooremppic.twitter.com/bHusYEda7V
We had a great roundtable discussion about all the opportunities for our town's children.https://twitter.com/nickgibbuk/status/1017410077827870720 …
Opening the RSPCA summer fair, I thanked them for the amazing work they do to protect innocent animals.https://buff.ly/2N62xpx
Very sad news about Lord Carrington. He was a titan of the Conservative Party, and he dedicated his life and his talents to serving our country.

Many thanks to @damienmooremp for showing your support and being one of the contributors who pledged to stand #ShoulderToShoulder with the NHS against cancer #NHS70https://twitter.com/CRUK_Policy/status/1014844211982675970 …
Britain voted to leave the EU - TM is delivering on that result and the will of the people; we need a Party united to deliver a Brexit that works, not one divided by individual grandstanding.
Hi @AnneMWolf, do you have an email address? I would like yo contact you re Tunisia APPG.

Although we are leaving the EU, we will still be in Europe, and need to create a new relationship with our allies after Brexit. I had a good discussion about this with @Xavier_Bettel, the Luxembourg Prime Minister, last week.pic.twitter.com/JvVCDb3yeq

Britain's best high street will be announced in November. I would love Lord Street to win, and for a local project to get the £10,000 prize! 

Community groups can register Lord Street by visiting http://thegreatbritishhighstreet.co.uk  - or by getting in touch with me.

Over a thousand antisemitic incidents were recorded in the UK last year. Yet even more worrying than antisemitism in our own country is the hatred that drives Hamas. 

Watch my speech todayhttps://youtu.be/OfzwywQMa_E
Calling all schools in Southport! The next International School Award accreditation deadline is 15 July 2018. Apply now https://buff.ly/2tcNUrM  @schoolsonline #ApplyInternational
Our region was seriously affected by Carillion's fall. In the 'Telegraph' today, @DLidington outlines how we will avoid similar crises in the futurehttps://buff.ly/2yFzlD5
Was great to show @damienmooremp some of the amazing work of our members @JamiPeople and @Jewish_Care this morning.pic.twitter.com/INKLpbUsJ4

Thankyou @NRAS_UK for presenting James from @Scarisbrickhall with an award to acknowledge his fundraising. Our MP @damienmooremp gave his support and it was a pleasure to meet him,  @EmmaLewellBuck and Prof Lucy Wedderburn in the Palace of Westminster #jiaparliament2018pic.twitter.com/TV1ksn23jz
I'm incredibly impressed by the work that the @RSPCA_official do to protect vulnerable animals in our townhttps://buff.ly/2tmdr1U

Heathrow ought to look for suppliers in the North West. 

I made this point to the airport's CEO, John Holland-Kaye. We also discussed its long-term projects and managing their environmental impact.pic.twitter.com/SE3wh9xePM

Today, The Environment Secretary has announced support for Finn’s Law, to provide more protection for the brave police service animals who protect us. We are continuing to raise the bar on animal welfare, whether it be for our beloved pets, brave service animals or on farms.pic.twitter.com/Y82xRar5iS

Onto Bates Farms and Dairy in Birkdale, a local family-run business which has been operating in Southport for 78 years. Great to see their business doing well and continuing to distribute across the north-west. Thanks to Chris and the team. #SmallBizSatUK (2)pic.twitter.com/opNttEulL9
